think_procedure.2: Understand the function of the knob: statement_timeout in PostgreSQL sets the maximum allowed duration of any statement, in milliseconds.
think_procedure.3: Determine if the knob has special values: In PostgreSQL, setting statement_timeout to 0 means that there is no timeout for statements, effectively disabling the timeout feature.
think_procedure.4: Classify the knob based on special values: Since setting statement_timeout to 0 changes its behavior significantly (disabling the timeout), it qualifies as a 'special knob'.
think_procedure.5: Identify the special value: The special value for statement_timeout is 0.
